translated: The Elders’ Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Short Accounts
The Story of the Elder Bhisadāyaka
“The one named Vessabhū,
was the third of the seers;
Having gone to the forest, the pleasure grove,
the supreme man dwelt there.

analyzed: bhisa muḷālam gaṇhitvā  agamam buddha santika
translated: Taking a clump of grass,🔽I went into the presence of the Buddha;
And I offered it to the Buddha,

analyzed: pasannaḥ sehi pāṇibhi  karena ca parāmaṭṭhaḥ
translated: delighted with my own hands.
And the supreme Buddha Vessabhū🔽touched it with his hand;
I do not recall any happiness
equal to that, let alone greater.
This is my last birth,
all future lives have been destroyed;
Having gone with the elephant chief,
I have planted the wholesome.
In the twenty-ninth eon,
the deed I did then;
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving grass.
The kings who were my relatives,
sixteen human rulers;
In the thirteenth eon they were,
wheel-turning monarchs of great power.
The four analytical knowledges,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā bhisadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā bhisadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus has the venerable Bhisadāyaka told this verse.
The Story of the Elder Bhisadāyaka is finished.
